issue.title: Performance regression from v1.12.0 to v1.13.0 (and master)

repository.name: sftp
repository.description: SFTP support for the go.crypto/ssh package

issue.body:
While investigating https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/5197 I discovered that doing transfers to rsync.net had gone from 300 KB/s in v1.12.0 to 100KB/s in v1.13.0

The rsync.net servers run FreeBSD which is one unusual thing about them and the other is that they are a long way away from me (150ms) so have the usual problems with long fat TCP pipes. Rclone uses the `ReadFrom` interface in the sftp client so that the sftp library can increase the number of outstanding packets to help with this.

Here are some tests (my upload is capable of 2MB/s).

    make && rclone version && rclone copy -vv --stats 10s /tmp/499.91M rsyncnet: 2>&1 | grep 499.91M:

v1.12.0

```
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 312.432k/s, 27m8s
 *                                       499.91M:  1% /499.910M, 309.264k/s, 27m15s
 *                                       499.91M:  1% /499.910M, 281.361k/s, 29m49s
 *                                       499.91M:  2% /499.910M, 312.820k/s, 26m37s
 *                                       499.91M:  3% /499.910M, 347.230k/s, 23m48s
```

v1.13.0

```
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 81.331k/s, 1h44m44s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 97.554k/s, 1h27m8s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 98.655k/s, 1h25m59s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 122.371k/s, 1h9m7s
 *                                       499.91M:  1% /499.910M, 122.173k/s, 1h9m4s
```

master

```
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 109.761k/s, 1h17m33s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 102.153k/s, 1h23m11s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 91.254k/s, 1h32m58s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 85.305k/s, 1h39m18s
 *                                       499.91M:  0% /499.910M, 76.641k/s, 1h50m23s
```

I bisected this change and discovered this commit is probably the problem. I'm reasonably sure that is the problem commit, and it is certainly touching the code in question. Before this commit at 0be6950c0e91d5cb73a4d690270d3a5010ac9808 the performance is definitely OK and after it is is bad. However there is some variation after the commit so there may be more commits involved.

> commit fc156996912168806d33b55794e2f5436fae2c3d
> Author: Cassondra Foesch
> Date:   Sun Feb 21 20:32:09 2021 +0000
> 
>     fixed concurrent writes, mid-polish
> 
>  client.go | 614 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++------------------------
>  1 file changed, 373 insertions(+), 241 deletions(-)


Cc: @puellanivis

body:
This looks like a failure within the sftp library.

It might be some sort of networking problem.

Is it 100% repeatable?

I have an rsync.net account I can test things on.

In testing this I found a performance regression - v1.54 transfers at  aout 300KB/s whereas 1.55 transfers at about 100KB/s

rsync.net is a long way from me ~150ms so it is the long fat pipe TCP problem.

I used git bisect to discover that this is the problem commit 713f8f357dc5eb512f736ad97cb092dfbd1dbfe9

>     sftp: fix "file not found" errors for read once servers - fixes #5077
>     
>     It introduces a new flag --sftp-disable-concurrent-reads to stop the
>     problematic behaviour in the SFTP library for read-once servers.
>     
>     This upgrades the sftp library to v1.13.0 which has the fix.

I've bisected this futher and reported it to the sftp package bug tracker: https://github.com/pkg/sftp/issues/426

In the mean time can you try this which reverts the the library to v1.12.0 and see if it fixes your problem

[v1.56.0-beta.5357.b89d085cb.fix-5197-sftp-regression](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5197-sftp-regression/v1.56.0-beta.5357.b89d085cb.fix-5197-sftp-regression/) on branch [fix-5197-sftp-regression](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5197-sftp-regression) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thanks for your quick response.

The problem is 100% reproducible using sftp. (Not relevant, I guess, but I have another backup using rclone to a webdav server which succeeds.)

Ping to rsync.net is 200-250m/s for me, so also a long way, but has been consistent and reliable for 2 years using rclone (thanks).

I tried v1.56.0-beta but the uploaded failed with:
2021-04-04 06:41:26 ERROR : Attempt 3/3 failed with 1 errors and: Update Close failed: failed to send packet: EOF

Although the speed was normal and 3 times faster at 1.418 MBytes/s than v1.55.0

I'm happy to keep trying and thanks again.

BTW, as expected, all sync/copy actions succeeded to Mega and webdav accounts with v1.55.0 and v1.56.0-beta.

To try and eliminate any network issues, all test (including rsync.net) carried out with and without wireguard VPN. No difference to results or speed.

I can confirm that this branch with the SFTP fix has partially resolved my issues with 1.55 and various 1.56 betas - Slow SFTP speeds but not EOF issues - going to try 1.54.

Edit: Went back to 1.53 and speed and EOF issues seem to be resolved - TBC but I'm way past the point that 1.55 or later (inc. that SFTP regression version) gets to.
I managed to reproduce the EOF failure and I'm trying to bisect the problem - it may take a while...

Bisect worked and came up with this very likely candidate

> commit a3fcadddc871e646f7ce756fa5d168d4bdd6997c
> Author: Nick Craig-Wood <nick@craig-wood.com>
> Date:   Fri Feb 12 18:41:37 2021 +0000
> 
>     sftp: close idle connections after --sftp-idle-timeout (1m by default)
>     
>     This fixes a problem where sftp backends live on forever when using
>     the rc and use more and more connections.
>     
>     Fixes #4883
> 
>  backend/sftp/sftp.go | 70 +++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++-----------------
>  1 file changed, 48 insertions(+), 22 deletions(-)

This was released in v1.55.0 which means v1.54.0 should have been OK too.

I will have a go at fixing this shortly.

rename.to: sftp: Update ReadFrom failed: failed to send packet: EOF errors and very slow

body:
I've attempted to fix this here

[v1.56.0-beta.5365.87a8c8817.fix-5197-sftp-regression](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-5197-sftp-regression/v1.56.0-beta.5365.87a8c8817.fix-5197-sftp-regression/) on branch [fix-5197-sftp-regression](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-5197-sftp-regression) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

This fixes
- uploads which take longer than 1 minute
- downloads which take longer than 1 minute
- the speed regression

Testing appreciated!

Yep - seems to have worked OK (passed the 5 min mark anyway...)

This must have been your addition? "Not closing 4 unused connections as 1 transfers in progress"

Thanks!

> Yep - seems to have worked OK (passed the 5 min mark anyway...)

Great!
 
> This must have been your addition? "Not closing 4 unused connections as 1 transfers in progress"

That is the fix.

It is the simplest I could make it as I want to put it into 1.55.1!

Works for me, too.

Transferred:      499.910M / 499.910 MBytes, 100%, 1.416 MBytes/s, ETA 0s
Checks:                 3 / 3, 100%
Transferred:            1 / 1, 100%
Elapsed time:      5m57.8s

Thanks for the excellent software and quick response.

Regards

Thank you all for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.55.1 and v1.56
Great, I'll pull the latest beta and keep an eye on it this week to confirm.
I'm having this issue, i'll test `rclone v1.56.0-beta.5386.e7b736f8c` tonight.
